wikipedia_page.main:
George Holme Sumner (10 November 1760 - 26 June 1838) was at various stages throughout the 18th and 19th century the Member of Parliament (MP)  for Ilchester, Guildford and Surrey.
Born in Calcutta, he was educated at Harrow School and Emmanuel College, Cambridge.

response: *George Holme Sumner (1760–1838), MP for Ilchester, Guildford and Surrey

Born in Surrey, England, James Hardy Vaux was the son of Hardy Vaux, butler and house steward to George Holme Sumner MP of Hatchlands Park, and his wife Sophia, the daughter of an attorney. Vaux spent much of his childhood living with his maternal grandparents in Shropshire, England.
